Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tinman3
Reviews.Content: No real complaints here regarding the hotel and room, and based on previous stays in Istanbul I think this is a great value place. One special feature of this place are all the wonderful carpets and kilims in our room and throughout the hotel. My wife has a preference for tile and wood floors, so enjoyed our room for this. Our bathroom was very basic and though large was rather depressing so the only negative (also after a very rainy day, nothing left in the bathroom was dry in the morning). We had a triple room that had two TV's, didn't use them but our son was excited to have his own options. The breakfast room was fantastic for the view and the food. Service was excellent from lobby to terrace and we would not hesitate to stay here again. The location is great, and though we were next to a somewhat busy one-way street road noise was minimal and not a bother at all....easy walk to the Grand Bazaar, Arrasta Bazaar, and the rest of Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: KatyG_1
Reviews.Content: I thought that the hotel had a lovely location right in the heart of Istanbul next to the blue mosque. At first I thought the room was a bit dark but settled in quickly and that did not matter. The room was basic but very clean, warm, and comfortable. The staff are lovely and very helpful and came straight away when I had a problem with my hair drier! The breakfast rooftop had fab views, was very relaxing with a nice selection of food. Fab stay would definitely recommend if you're looking for comfort without all the extras!

Reviews.Title: “Ecstatic With Our Choice In Istanbul - Loved Hotel Fehmi Bey”
Reviews.Author: flymeaway2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights the last week in September and when we arrived and opened the door to our room we were extremely happy with our choice for Istanbul. The location couldn't be better. You are steps from the Hippodrome and its surrounding sites plus walking distance to anywhere in Sultanhamet. From check in to check out and everything in between, the staff were friendly, professional and most helpful when we required it. I booked a "deluxe" category room directly with the hotel via e-mail. On arrival, reception provided us with a map and guidance about the sites. Our room was charming, spacious, clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and I comment because when staying 6 nights you very much hope for a comfortable mattress. Breakfast is served on the rooftop by two very efficient and professional men. I repeat myself when I'm happy with a hotel and reviewing by saying a "hotel is only as good as its management and staff" and it is so true. The breakfast provided boiled eggs, cheeses, tomatoes, cucumbers, meats, scrambled eggs, cereal, "delicious" fresh bread, yogurt and honey and more. The rooftop is a very enjoyable start to your day. We loved Hotel Fehmi Bey and would definitely return to this hotel. Thank you to the staff for helping to make our first visit to Istanbul so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Old-fashioned service and family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: elsie31
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous terrace and breakfast area, good service, good staff retention. The wine is good, and the service fantastic. The rooms are well-decorated, clean and comfortable. The view from the terrace of the old Theodesian Harbor is spectacular. Out of the major hubbub of Sultanahmet, but easily accessible by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelibrarian
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on many occasions and love the central location and the staff. It is a family run place which is much warmer and more personal than chain hotels. Staff remembered me from one stay to the next and were really helpful if I had problems locating an address or reading something in Turkish. Great value for the money. Just minutes from all Sultanahmet area attractions. Breakfast on the roof has a fabulous view of the Marmara and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, perfect location, and a wonderful roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Stefan41
Reviews.Content: We found Fehmi Bey at the Internet, as we were searching for a cheepish hotel in Sultan Ahmed with a good roof terrace. And we were not disapointed. The hotel has a family feel to it. The staff in the reception were always helpful, and the room was kept clean and tidy. We stayed in the family appartement on the 1:st floor. No particular view, and rather boring with nothing on the walls. However, this was compensated by the spacious bed rooms and, in particular, the wast living room. Great for kids running around. The location close to the ancient Hipodrome and the Blue Mosque is perfect, with spectacular views of the mosque, Haga Sofia, and the Bosphorus from the roof terrace. The terrace is a lovely place to spend a lot of time, reading or enjoying the hotel's excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn and service”
Reviews.Author: ebmj
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport by the good driver sent by the Hotel, and the service remained friendly and efficient all through our 3 night stay. Our room was small (as expected in this historical district), very clean and very well appointed. The view from our 3rd floor was great, and the A/C and beds were very comfortable. The hotel is 5 to 20 walking minutes away from the main sights you want to see in Istanbul, and the street car is a short walk away. There was complementary bottled water in our room upon arrival (not so in other, more expensive hotels in Turkey) and complementary tea, etc. on the roof patio in the evenings. The included breakfast, also served on the roof-top, was very good: a good but not overdone variety of Turkish and other foods, and nice and fresh. The front desk will recommend places to eat - if you take the time to ask for the kind of dining you want, they'll give you a very good recommendation. Liked best: location and ambiance. Can't think of anything that we didn't like!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy, quiet, and VERY NICE location!”
Reviews.Author: Tokayo
Reviews.Content: It was 1st time for us to visit Istanbul and we stayed 3 nights at Fehmi Bey. Very nice location and most of sightseeing spots are within walking distance. Blue mosque, Hagia Sphia, Topkapi Place, Grand Bazaar, etc. We stayed standard room but I could see Blue mosque in front and it was very beautiful especially in the evening it gets illuminated. And the view from their roof terrace was just gourgious... If you are morning person, you can take a quiet walk around Blue mosque area before it crowded by tourists. Hotel staffs are always kind and nice. I would like to stay their hotel again for next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travellocks
Reviews.Content: Fehmi Bey is just round the corner from the Hippodrome and the azure mosque with a top covering peak morning meal terrace that overlooks the ocean of Marama and the azure mosque. Rooms are well conceived with up to date bathrooms. The staff is just fine directed by an over-fed golden Lab entitled homer Simpson. Great morning meal with abounding of dining alternatives in the area. Pick up at the airport was glossy even with a air travel delay.

Reviews.Title: “best location in Sultanahmed”
Reviews.Author: cake_walk_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a Deluxe double room. The room was large and clean with big windows to catch the breeze and AC for when it got too hot. The bathroom was even larger and spotless. Our only complaint was that the bed was very hard, not the soft hotel beds we were used to. The hotel is about a 30 second walk from the Hippodrome and right beside the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, cistern, the main shopping street and about 10 mins walk to the Grand Bazaar. It was lovely to just walk around the cobbled streets and enjoy the pretty window-boxes and old buildings. The hotel is on a small side street which can get very busy and congested in the afternoons. We closed our windows one afternoon to catch a nap and generally kept the windows closed at night to keep some of the noise out. But this was a minor problem and well worth the great location. The airport transfer guy was very nice and drove safely (unlike all the other drivers in Turkey). He had to wait over an hour for us to clear customs but there wasn't a word of compaint and he got us to the hotel quickly but in one piece. Breakfast each day was quite basic but fine - lots of breads, cheeses, sliced meats, scrambled eggs with cereals and lovely chunks of watermelon. Hotel staff were very helpful. They held some of our luggage for a week while we traveled around. They offered us a late check-out, and even when we had already checked-out, they offered for us to shower and change before we went to the airport. We enjoyed our stay and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “charming budget hotel in Sultanahmed”
Reviews.Author: sweettangerine
Reviews.Content: he Fehmi Bey is a small and friendly family-owned hotel right in the historic heart of Istanbul, Sultanahmed, in a quiet street, just around the corner from the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosk. The location is ideal if you plan to do a lot of sightseeing, though I wouldn't recommend it to party animals, as after the herds of tourists have left for he night, the area is pretty dead. With only 20-something rooms, guests get a very personal welcome and approach. The receptionists are always ready to give advice about where to go, what to see and how to get there. They were also extremely helpful in organising us a taxi to the airport very early in the morning upon departure. Guests can freely use the 2 computers at the lobby and there even is a printer that can be used free of charge (great to print boarding passes) Breakfast is served on the top floor, with a nice view over the Marmara Sea. There is only a small buffet, but with a surprisingly large choice for such a small hotel. Apart from the extensive continental buffet there were also eggs and saussages. The room was tiny but very clean with all necessary amenties: a safe (complimentary), hair dryer, tv and fully fitted bathroom. We had a corner room on the 4th floor, overlooking the Marmara Sea. The only negative remark I can make is that the room wasn't very sound proof and we were woken up early by the seagulls on the roof, but we didn't suffer much for other noices. On Saturday night there was noice from the restaurant on the top floor until about midnight, but afterwards all was quiet again. All in all a cosy and budget friendly place for a city break!

Reviews.Title: “this is my home away from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: YEGtogo
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that I have been staying at for over 7 years each time I make my way in and out of Istanbul. The location is perfect, the staff and owners are Special human beings- truly warm, thoughtful people. The hotel is great- the rooms soothing, quiet, the breakfast a treat as you watch the ships on the Bosphorus... Just a wonderful hotel, a nice walk from where you want to go, the tram close by. The Aya Sophia, Sultanahmet Camii (Blue Mosque) are the neighbors. You can't beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MissPigi
Reviews.Content: We chose Fehmi Bey based on reviews on TA website. I would say our stay was just average. The pickup from the airport (free) was so late we started looking for other options to get to the hotel. At 11:00 at night we were less than thrilled. We finally found him & although a bit annoyed, decided not to let this hinder our vacation. The greeting at the hotel was quite icy...maybe because it was late, but there was a young boy who showed us to our room who was very sweet. The room was nothing to write home about....which is why I only give this hotel 3 stars. Although it was large, it was sparsely furnished & looked NOTHING like the pictures on the internet. There was 1 double bed & 1 twin bed, a few night stands and a mini fridge with overpriced drinks. I was expecting a plush feeling room and instead it felt quite cold. The bathroom was nice however. It was quite spacious and after coming from Greece where we had no stand up showers, the big shower was a luxury. We didn't complain because it was just too late and we were too tired. The breakfast was very nice at the roof of the hotel. It was raining both mornings we ate there, but I'm sure it would have been even nicer to eat outside. There was a wide variety of items both "American" style and Turkish. The apple tea is the best!!!! For non-smokers, you'll be happy to know the inside area is smoke free, which we found to be rare in Turkey. There is a computer with free internet in the lobby for guest use. The location of this hotel is very good. It is on a quiet side street close to Blue Mosque, Topkapi, and St. Sophia. You can walk to many restaurants. We found it a bit disorienting to take the tram to the Egyptian Market. We were there during Ramadan and in the park near the hotel there were many food stalls and vendors out at night. Families came to have their dinner and many of them made picnics on the lawn. It was really nice to stroll around and sample so many foods from Turkey in one place. I am not sure who people were dealing with when they write about the great service at this hotel. On a few instances we asked the older man at the front desk some questions....about getting around, restaurants, etc....and he always seemed annoyed to be bothered and didn't give us much help. The morning we were checking out he tried to charge us in Lira, not Euros, which we were quoted in. He kept giving us the price in euros and then changing it to Lira using his calculator. The rate his was using in his conversion was nothing near the rate at the exchange offices. He also tried to charge us for 2 drinks from the mini bar, that we did not drink. He did end up taking that off our bill. I felt like we were being ripped off, but our bus was waiting to take us to the airport and could not argue anymore. The whole thing was quite shady. We took a shared van to the airport which we booked through a small cafe on the corner of the street in front of the hotel. It was a better value for us rather than taking a taxi, but be aware, they make many stops, so if you are one of the first hotels to be picked up, plan extra time to get there. All in all, the rooms were just o.k., location was good and breakfast was great. While not expensive it wasn't as cheap as some of the other hotels we saw in the same area. I booked it because it looked more luxurious and wanted something a bit more posh while in Istanbul and because of that I was disappointed. I would not stay here again, but wouldn't tell anyone they shouldn't either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and convenient location, large, airy rooms, terrific staff and customer service.”
Reviews.Author: RosSydney
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed five days and nights at fehmi Bey and loved every minute of it. The Hotel is very conveniently located just one block from the Hippodrome and within walking distance of most of old Istanbul and the tram. There is a lovely rooftop breakfast area with fabulous views. We also had sunset drinks up here regularly as the views over the water and harbour and out to the Blue Mosque were fabulous. There is also a casual seating area for reading, relaxin or just view watching. The rooms are very airy and spacious. We had the three corner rooms so there were windows on two sides of each room. Very pleasantly decorated, firm but comfortable bed and a relaxed seating area. A large and airy bathroom off each room also with windows. All very pleasant with plenty of room to move. The staff were terrific. There was always someone on hand to help or offer advice and they were always courteous and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The customer service was excellent. I would stay here again should I revisit Turkey and would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Ros - Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: fromzim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fehmi Bey for 6 nights in August. The hotel is in a pretty building on the corner of a charming Sultanahmet street. It is well decorated and run by a friendly, discrete staff. We were met at the airport as promised and whisked to the hotel in what seemed like moments. We received a warm welcome and were shown straight up to our room. Our room was LARGE (corner room), tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean, with a modern bathroom with bath tub shower. Mini fridge stocked at reasonable prices, TV, safe and big comfortable bed. The roof top terrace where a fresh and varied buffet breakfast is served has a fantastic view of the Sea of Marmara and the Islands as well as the Blue Mosque. The terrace can be used at all hours of the day and night by guests and is a wonderful place to relax. Meals brought in from a near by restaurant are very reasonably priced. Drinks were also well priced with tea and coffee served ALL day at no charge. The Fehmi Bey could not be better located within Sultanahmet. It is literally steps from the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque and within easy reach of the Sultanahmet tram stop. We fell in love with Istanbul and if we are lucky enough to return one day, we would definitely stay at the Fehmi Bey again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bed like cement”
Reviews.Author: lhkl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the excellent reviews on this board. It is well located, a block from the Hippodrome. The hotel provided airport pick up since we stayed for 3 days. We booked what they called their executive room which is on the 4th floor, has a terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and water. This room is higher priced than a standard room. They provide a good buffet breakfast on the roof top with a nice view. The hotel was very clean and the employees were very nice. The only negative was the bed which might have had the hardest mattress I have ever slept on. It definitely was uncomfotable and unfortunately affects my overall view of this hotel. I don't know if all rooms have beds like this so I can only comment on my experience. This is something to check out before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, ideal place”
Reviews.Author: RyanLChicago
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good about this hotel. Great value for the cost. The location is just a few hundred meters walk from the Sultanahmet tram stop and the Blue Mosque; so easy access from and to anywhere in Istanbul, including the airport by public transit for under $3. The view from the terrace where breakfast is served and one can relax at any time is spectacular: Sea of Marmara on one side, Blue Mosque on the other. Breakfast is very good. We split our stay -- 4 then 3 nights -- with travel to other parts of Turkey between. Both times we arrived early morning -- once at 8:00am -- and were able to get right into our room. We were invited to enjoy breakfast for free even though we had not stayed the preceding night. The area is very quiet at night. Lots of good restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet people at the Fehmi Bey”
Reviews.Author: SuPaul
Reviews.Content: The staff is a real gem at the Fehmi Bey. They are helpful and kind. The rooms are average, the views, spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Chico46
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the very positive reviews found in TripAdvisor. I chose the hotel due to that and now I definitely must agree with the numerous good reviews: the Fehmi Bey is an excelent hotel in Istanbul. Good location, charming decoration, clean, discrete and helpful staff. The room was not so big but OK, with nice carpets (the owner trades carpets) and a small but very complete bathroom. Gorgeous terrace on the last floor with a wonderful seaview, confortable furniture and a magnificent breakfast buffet. Pity I couldn't stay there longtime. Worth the price. I would certainly be a guest again. LH, from Rio de Janeiro

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TTK
Reviews.Content: The Fehmi Bey is in a great location about 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque (you can get a great view of it from the Terrace), and 10 minutes from Topkapi Palace. However, despite its central location, it is in a very quiet side street. We opted for one of the suites and whilst not large it was a good enough size and it was good to have our own sitting room in addition to bedroom. The room was tastefully decorated and the lounge had TV and fridge. The restaurant/terrace has great views over the sea of Marmara and you can see great sunsets. Breakfast was an OK buffet - typically turkish and a reasonable choice. There was some hot food but it didn't look particularly appealing. The hotel was very clean and the staff all very friendly and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Fehmi Bey is great!”
Reviews.Author: kenrich
Reviews.Content: Date: August 10, 2006 Reviewer: A Trip Advisor member. Review: My husband and I stayed at the Fehmi Bey in Istanbul recently for 6 nights, and we recommmend it without reservation. The Fehmi Bey is a boutique hotel about half a block from the Hippodrome -- a wonderful, easy-to-find (and this is important in Sultanahmet) location. The hotel is within easy walking distance of most of the Sultanahmet sites and is about a 25 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar. Our double room (cost: 90 euros) was medium-sized, immaculately clean, with comfortable beds, adequate airconditioning, and a stupendous view of the Sea of Marmara. The Fehmi Bey has a large roof top terrace with lots of comfortable seating and gorgeous views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. It's tempting to spend all day there. They provide a good Turkish breakfast, with plenty of variety. They also have a convenient Internet facility. But the best part of the Fehmi Bey is the staff -- they are extremely helpful without being intrusive. We were traveling with friends who stayed in another hotel, and they ended up using our hotel as a headquarters, and having the front desk make reservations, get taxis, etc. The Fehmi Bey staff were always helpful and courteous to our friends, as well as to us. Truly a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Option”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fehmi Bey for an a week in the spring. We had a great experience and plan on staying there on any subsequent visits to Istanbul. The location, as others have mentioned, is perfect. It is literally steps to the Hippodrome. Also, the rooftop terrace with views of the Blue Mosque is stunning. The service was excellent-we would call down for a big bottle of mineral water, and a staff member would sprint up the stairs and have it at our door in under a minute. I recommend asking for a larger corner room, as some of the rooms can be small.

Reviews.Title: “location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Teljuk
Reviews.Content: Fehmi Bey is just around the corner from the hippodrome and the blue mosque with a roof top breakfast terrace that overlooks the sea of marama and the blue mosque. Rooms are well designed with modern bathrooms. The staff is just fine led by an over-fed golden Lab named homer simpson. Great breakfast with plenty of dining choices in the area. Pick up at the airport was smooth even with a flight delay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Fehmi Bey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Fehmi Bey. We asked for a corner room, which they obliged. Our room had wonderful views of the Bosporus. The continental breakfast was excellent. The restaurant had a great views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosporus. Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and Aya Sofia were within a few blocks. It was wonderful to find such a wonderful hotel at a reasonable price. Great views from corner windows and rooftop restaurant. Modern, clean and well designed rooms. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful spot in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Fehmi Bey is in a perfect location - literally, a few blocks away from the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, and the waterfront (on the other side). The rooms range from small to large, but all have good, functional bathrooms (with excellent water pressure), extremely comfortable beds, and good bedside lighting. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace, which has a spectacular view of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. It is comfortable, inviting, and the staff are friendly - more than happy to bring you a drink or a snack, or not, if you'd prefer. A friendly dog - Bart - watches over the hotel from the lobby, as do the staff, who are always around, but never obtrusive. I found the Fehmi Bey to be a perfect choice in Sultanahmet, and would highly recommend it. Rates seem to be negotiable, but all to whom I spoke at the hotel felt that they were getting good value for their rate. My own room overlooked the Blue Mosque - you realloy can't beat that.
